avalancheActivity.comment:
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and on very steep sunny slopes medium-sized wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. On very steep sunny slopes the likelihood of avalanches will increase during the day.
Gliding avalanches can be released at any time of day or night, in particular on extremely steep grassy slopes below approximately 2700 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.

As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations stabilised. The large quantity of fresh snow of last week and very particularly the wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads,, in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example in particular in high Alpine regions.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in danger of moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise on Tuesday to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

The various wind slabs have bonded generally well with the old snowpack. Isolated small and medium-sized slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2300 m on very steep sunny slopes.

In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying.

tendency.highlights: In the afternoon as the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations will stabilise.

avalancheActivity.comment:
On extremely steep sunny slopes numerous small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry and moist snow slides are to be expected as the day progresses, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain.
The fresh snow of the last seven days as well as the wind slabs can still be released in some cases, in particular on extremely steep slopes, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example. On very steep sunny slopes the likelihood of avalanches will increase during the day.
To some extent avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach medium size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in danger of moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise on Tuesday to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on very steep sunny slopes in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Hardly any mostly small slab avalanches have been released by people in the last few days. The various wind slabs have bonded generally well with the old snowpack.

Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
Snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitude a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2300 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: In the afternoon as the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches.

avalancheActivity.comment:
On extremely steep sunny slopes small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized dry and moist snow slides are to be expected as the day progresses, in particular at the base of rock walls, and in steep rocky terrain.
Little snow fell on Saturday. In addition mostly small wind slabs formed adjacent to ridgelines on west, northwest and north facing slopes and generally in the high Alpine regions. As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures the snow drift accumulations stabilised. They can be released in isolated cases, especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas, and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, when entering gullies and bowls for example, in particular on extremely steep slopes.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Slight increase in danger of moist avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is now lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
As a consequence of highly fluctuating temperatures and solar radiation a crust formed on the surface, in particular below approximately 2300 m on very steep sunny slopes.

tendency.highlights: In the afternoon as the temperature drops there will be only a very slight increase in the danger of wet avalanches.
